required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: N-acetylcysteine for the Treatment of Cannabis Dependence: Working Mechanisms
clinical_study.official_title: N-acetylcysteine for the Treatment of Cannabis Dependence: Working Mechanisms

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the effects of repeated NAC administration on glutamate concentrations in the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC), on neurocognitive functioning, and on neuro-inflammatory parameters in adult cannabis-dependent individuals.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at study end (2 weeks after study start)
primary_outcome.description: Glutamate concentrations in the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at study end (2 weeks after study start)
secondary_outcome.description: Stop Signal Reaction Time (SSRT) on the Stop Signal Task

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at study end (2 weeks after study start)
secondary_outcome.description: Indifference point measured by a Monetary Delayed Discounting Task

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at study end (2 weeks after study start)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in response time for incongruent-congruent stimuli on a Stroop task

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at study end (2 weeks after study start)
